OpenCopilot is at 4.2K GitHub stars! ‚≠ê‚≠ê

https://github.com/openchatai/OpenCopilot

It's a way to let your product's users chat with your product functionality and execute stuff by text, a kind of custom AI copilot. & We released a lot of cool things.

Mostly, The could version now is much more‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744893848634171404

LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight:

‚ÜîÔ∏èIntegrations

With nearly 700 integrations, LangChain makes it easy to get started no matter your tech stack

As part of v0.1.0, we've made some changes to the package architecture to make our partnerships more stable and production ready

item.title: üéèüï∏Ô∏èStreaming with LangGraph Yesterday, we introduced LangGraph as way to construct language agents as graphs Because this is built on LangChain...
item.description:
üéèüï∏Ô∏èStreaming with LangGraph

Yesterday, we introduced LangGraph as way to construct language agents as graphs

Because this is built on LangChain, it comes with the ability to stream intermediate steps as well as tokens

Check it out: https://github.com/langchain-ai/langgraph

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇNat Guy
.@LangChainAI announces an early peak at LangGraph for cyclic (looping), state-full agent workflows.

To define: Hey ai agent, do x with this tool until you‚Äôre done. Then do something else. Then stop.

https://github.com/langchain-ai/langgraph

@DavidKPiano thoughts?

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇAustin Vance
New tutorial, this time not from me from one of our badass AI devs @curious_kaylynn on how to debug your @LangChainAI LCEL applications even if you're not one of the lucky ones with a LangSmith integration!

It's just too easy and so fun on @LangChainAI!

https://youtu.be/l1JRl3Mvln0

item.title: RT Hard Kothari: After making it easy to build orchestrated steps (chains) easy using LCEL, @LangChainAI has once again introduced new feature of Lang...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇHard Kothari
After making it easy to build orchestrated steps (chains) easy using LCEL, @LangChainAI has once again introduced new feature of LangGraphs to make it easy to work with agents.

The idea behind is to make it more modular and easy to work with agents and building them with more‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744735659846438921
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Michael Struwig ü¶ã: The most interesting thing about the @LangChainAI v0.1 announcement is the release of `langgraph` (https://github.com/langcha...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇMichael Struwig ü¶ã
The most interesting thing about the @LangChainAI v0.1 announcement is the release of `langgraph` (https://github.com/langchain-ai/langgraph), which allows you to compose reasoning "workflows" in a graph-like fashion, where the agent is able to make decisions on which steps to take next.

If‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744696099141517752
item.author: LangChain

item.description:
ü¶úüìπLangChain v0.1.0 YouTube Series

We released a series of videos walking through the seven main components of our new v0.1.0 release

We also added notebooks (in both Python and JS) for a hands-on coding experience for all of them

YouTube playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfaIDFEXuae0gBSJ9T0w7cu7iJZbH3T31‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744523182554660916

RT‚ÄÇJuri Wiens üá∫üá¶
Great, LangGraph finally offers an API that makes it possible to define custom cyclic @LangChainAI powered workflows such as agent loops.

https://x.com/LangChainAI/status/1744419476882473391?s=20


LangChain:‚ÄÇü¶úüï∏Ô∏èLangGraph

‚ö° Building language agents as graphs ‚ö°

https://github.com/langchain-ai/langgraph

The "one more thing" from our LangChain v0.1.0 announcement is introducing LangGraph to the world

ü§ñWe've been alpha testing this over the past six months as a better way to create LLM agents‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744419476882473391

item.title: RT Brace: Super excited for this! üöÄ üöÄ 0.1.0 is only the beginning. I know with the support from our amazing community and contributors, this ver...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇBrace
Super excited for this! üöÄ üöÄ

0.1.0 is only the beginning. I know with the support from our amazing community and contributors, this version and the followings will continue to make major impacts on the LLM ecosystem!


LangChain:‚ÄÇü¶úüöÄLangChain v0.1.0

After a year of development, we've released LangChain v0.1.0

Read the full blog here: https://blog.langchain.dev/langchain-v0-1-0/

After talking with the users and developers, we released this stable version and focused the library on a few core areas:

üëÄObservability:‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744411643482951829
